title: The Best Coconut Flour Chocolate Chunk Bars (paleo, gluten free)
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray 8x8 inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.

In a large bowl, whisk together coconut oil, honey, vanilla, eggs, and almond milk. In a separate medium bowl whisk together coconut flour, baking soda, and salt. Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients and mix until just combined and batter is smooth. Fold in chopped chocolate, reserved a few tablespoons for sprinkling on top if desired.

Bake for 20-22 minutes or until edges are golden brown and knife comes out with a few crumbs attached. The batter may look like it's not all the way cooked but it will be. DO NOT OVERBAKE or it will result in dried out bars and no one likes that! I always bake mine for 20 minutes and don't have any problems. Cool bars on a wire rack for at least 10 minutes so that they settle a bit, then cut into 16 squares. Enjoy!
ingredients: 1/3 cup honey, agave nectar or maple syrup
3 oz your favorite dairy free dark chocolate bar, coarsely chopped
